channel.title: Projects on Anish Saxena
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Anish Saxena

item.title: DABANGG: Cache Attack Optimizations
item.description:
Exploiting hardware optimizations for improving timing channel based cache attacks. Visit attack’s webpage for details.

Duration: April 2019 to June 2020

Mentor: Prof. Biswabandan Panda, CSE Dept. IIT Kanpur

item.title: Reconfigurable Space Antenna
item.description:
Introduction

Designed SMA actuator and low-power motor based antenna with 1 rotational & 2 translational degrees of freedom, and planned its signal reception & transmission.

Duration: January 2019 to February 2019

Mentor: Dr. Sahil Kalra (PhD), Space Technology Cell, IIT Kanpur (presently, Assistant Professor, IIT Jammu)

Details

  • Developed mechanism for ISRO to allow movement of space antenna deployed in satellite with 2 translation degrees of freedom.
  • Rendered 3D model using Autodesk Fusion, integrated low powered motor to allow rotational degree of freedom.
  • Utilized state memory alloy (SMA) actuator developed by Dr. Kalra to allow movement of axis of rotation.
  • Planned to use ISROâ€™s NavIC chip to allow transmission and reception of signals to control the antenna.
  • Studied signal transmission protocols pertinent to NavIC in order to devise communication strategies.

item.title: Campus Sustainability Challenge
item.description:
Introduction

Led a team of 6 individuals to identify problems in campus and implement innovative solutions to combat it.

Duration: October 2018 to December 2018

Competition: Inter IIT Tech Meet 2018, IIT Bombay

Details

  • Showcased the E-Waste Management Software developed in 2017 to display optimum treatment path, given some parameters
  • Integrated Biogas capturing mechanisms with Drum Composting to save up-to 14% of PNG consumption in Hall messes
  • Improved upon current composting practices by integrating Smart sensors for monitoring the state of compost

item.title: E-Waste Management Software
item.description:
Introduction

.NET framework based project for predictive analysis of best route to take in order to recycle E-waste given a set of initial parameters to consider

Duration: August 2017 to November 2017

Mentor: Prof. Indranil Saha, CSE Dept. IIT Kanpur

Details

  • Uses GUI based forms for taking user surveys and performs DataBase Management using MS Excel
  • Converts electronic gadgets input by the users into precise amounts of substances in E-waste
  • Implements self-designed algorithms to display best solutions for given set of data in a survey
  • Accounts for economic factors, environmental factors and performs relative analysis

item.title: Social Endeavours
item.description:
Descriptive Research: Climatic Cycle and Weather Regime

Introduction

Led a group of 4 individuals to conduct a research and field based project on the topic of “Climatic Cycle and Weather Regime- Needs and Aspirations of Future Generations”. Won the 2nd Prize at regional level in NCSC organized competition.

Duration: August 2015 to September 2015

Details

  • Spread awareness on harms of E-Waste in schools and nearby localities through street plays, posters and public speeches
  • Collected data on E-Waste generation in the school through surveys
  • Visited ISRO Ahmedabad to gather information on their state-of-the-art recycling techniques
  • Contacted various NGOs to help in collection and proper disposal of E-Waste

Case Study: Intersectionality and Access

Introduction

Participated in a month long workshop on accessibility issues faced by different sections of society. Learnt about the implications of such issues and conducted a field project in Kheda district near Ahmedabad on the theme of Women Empowerment. Received “Outstanding Social Action Project” certificate from ITSA International.

Duration: August 2013 to September 2013

Details

  • Received a token grant from ITSA International
  • Distributed study material to underprivileged students and reviewed their state of education
  • Conducted bi-weekly classes on basic education for 4 weeks for students
